div1.head: Military Orders for John H. Andrus, February 3, 1900
div1.p:
Adjutant General's
OFFICE,
FEB 15 1900
ROLLS DIVISION

ORDERS[unclear]
A. G. O.
RECD. FEB 12 1900

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, February 3, 1900.

1. Upon the recommendation of the Chief Surgeon of the
Division, the commanding officer, Columbia Barracks,
Cuba, will order Privates Claude M. Cook, James C. Gunn,
Edward P. Hammond and John Walton, Hospital Corps, U. S.
Army, now on duty at the post hospital at that post, to
appear before the board of officers convened by paragraph
5, Special Orders No. 12, current series, these headquarters,
for the purpose of examining them as to their qualifications
and fitness for detail as acting hospital stewards.

The board will be governed by the regulations prescribed
by, and render its report to the Chief Surgeon of the
Division.

2. Under authority of paragraph 1, General Orders, No.
31, series 1899, Headquarters of the Army, the Subsistence
Department will commute the rations of Commissary
Sergeant Gustave Schaupp, 8th Infantry, from December 28,
1899, to January 6, 1900, both days inclusive, while on
duty at the post commissary at Quemados, Cuba, at the
rate of one dollar and fifty cents, ($1.50) per day, it having
been impracticable to furnish him subsistence in any other
way.

3. Under authority of paragraph 2, General Orders No.
86, series of 1899, Headquarters of the Army, Privates
Hugo Mondrich, troop H, 2d U. S. Cavalry and Charles B.
Falck, company C, 2d U. S. Infantry, are hereby transferred
to the Hospital Corps, U. S. Army, and the former will
report to the surgeon at Santa Clara Barracks, and the
latter to the surgeon at Rowell Barracks, Cuba, for assign-
ment to duty.

4. Under authority of paragraph 2, General Orders No.
86, series of 1899, Headquarters of the Army, Private John
H. Andrus, Light Battery F, 2d Artillery, is hereby trans-
ferred to the Hospital Corps, U. S. Army, and will report
to the commanding officer, Military Hospital No. 1, for
assignment to temporary duty.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:

Spec & gen orders + circ letter
Division of Cuba Vol 175 A 1900
